Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Rent \Rent\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Rented}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Renting}.] [F. renter. See {Rent}, n.] 1. To grant the possession and enjoyment of, for a rent; to lease; as, the owwner of an estate or house rents it. [1913 Webster]
2. To take and hold under an agreement to pay rent; as, the tennant rents an estate of the owner. [1913 Webster]
renting n : the act of paying for the use of something (as an apartment or house or car) [syn: {rental}]
